EighthDay Theatre debuts an original English adaptation of Chinese legend ‘The Butterfly Lovers’ (May 8, 2022)

EighthDay Theatre Club performed its original show, “The Butterfly Lovers,” about navigating love and societal expectations Friday and Saturday in the Virginia Wadsworth Wirtz Center for the Performing Arts.

 Similar to the Chinese legend the show is based on, Zhu Yingtai’s parents disapprove of her love for her classmate Liang Shanbo.

 Lin Yanfei, who is passionate about photography, receives a job offer from National Geographic that strains her relationship with her fiance Chen Zijie.

 Zhu’s parents arrange for her to marry a wealthy merchant, Ma Wencai, though Zhu loves Liang.

 Lin’s parents approve of her fiance.

 Zhu corresponds with Liang through letters while they are separated.

 Zhu gives Liang her butterfly pin, which she was gifted on her first birthday.

  Lin and Chen have a marriage ceremony that leaves the audience interpreting whether they are wedded. In the Chinese legend, lovers Zhu and Liang become butterflies. Alt Text: A person in a white dress smiles at a person in a white traditional Chinese dress, while a person in the foreground looks on.
